intro: Galium gerardi var. parviflorum, commonly known as smallflower bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, ascending stems that are often hairy and bear small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, lanceolate, and have a distinctive hairy texture. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental flora.
